intro: Tococa parviflora subsp. manserichensis, commonly known as the Andean tococa, is a shrub native to the highlands of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and elliptical, leathery leaves. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
